description: From Middle English diffinicioun, from Middle French definition, from Latin dēfīnītiō, from dēfīniō. Equivalent to define +‎ -ition.

entries.meaning: (semantics, lexicography) A statement of the meaning of a word or word group or a sign or symbol (dictionary definitions).
examples: Your definition of "elephant" needs to be more precise than "a big animal with large ears".

entries.meaning: (usually with the definite article the) A clear instance conforming to the dictionary or textbook definition.
examples: Baroque is a good game, but only for a very narrow subset of the gaming audience. It is the very definition of a niche title.

entries.meaning: A statement expressing the essential nature of something; formulation
The action or process of defining.
The act of defining; determination of the limits.
The action or power of describing, explaining, or making definite and clear.
examples: Her comic genius is beyond definition.

entries.meaning: Clarity of visual presentation, distinctness of outline or detail.
examples: Improve the definition of an image.

entries.meaning: Clarity, especially of musical sound in reproduction.
Sharp demarcation of outlines or limits.
examples: A jacket with distinct waist definition.

entries.meaning: (bodybuilding) The degree to which individual muscles are distinct on the body.
(programming) A statement which provides a previous declaration with a value or body of a subroutine (in the case of function).
(mathematics) A statement that establishes the referent of a term or notation.
